day.description: The ISO 8601 format date of the resources in the file, for a UTC day

size.description: The size of the day's data file in bytes

create_date.description: The ISO 8601 format date when resources is created

friendly_name.description: The friendly name specified when creating the job

resource_type.description: The type of communication – Messages, Calls, Conferences, and Participants
The type of communication – Messages, Calls, Conferences, and Participants

links.description: Contains a dictionary of URL links to nested resources of this Export.

enabled.description: If true, Twilio will automatically generate every day's file when the day is over.

webhook_url.description: Stores the URL destination for the method specified in webhook_method.

webhook_method.description: Sets whether Twilio should call a webhook URL when the automatic generation is complete, using GET or POST. The actual destination is set in the webhook_url

resource_type.description: The type of communication – Messages, Calls, Conferences, and Participants

friendly_name.description: The friendly name specified when creating the job

resource_type.description: The type of communication – Messages, Calls, Conferences, and Participants

start_day.description: The start day for the custom export specified when creating the job

end_day.description: The end day for the export specified when creating the job

webhook_url.description: The optional webhook url called on completion of the job. If this is supplied, `WebhookMethod` must also be supplied.

webhook_method.description: This is the method used to call the webhook on completion of the job. If this is supplied, `WebhookUrl` must also be supplied.

email.description: The optional email to send the completion notification to

job_sid.description: The unique job_sid returned when the custom export was created

details.description: The details of a job which is an object that contains an array of status grouped by `status` state.  Each `status` object has a `status` string, a count which is the number of days in that `status`, and list of days in that `status`. The day strings are in the format yyyy-MM-dd. As an example, a currently running job may have a status object for COMPLETED and a `status` object for SUBMITTED each with its own count and list of days.

job_queue_position.description: This is the job position from the 1st in line. Your queue position will never increase. As jobs ahead of yours in the queue are processed, the queue position number will decrease

estimated_completion_time.description: this is the time estimated until your job is complete. This is calculated each time you request the job list. The time is calculated based on the current rate of job completion (which may vary) and your job queue position

details.description: The details of a job which is an object that contains an array of status grouped by `status` state.  Each `status` object has a `status` string, a count which is the number of days in that `status`, and list of days in that `status`. The day strings are in the format yyyy-MM-dd. As an example, a currently running job may have a status object for COMPLETED and a `status` object for SUBMITTED each with its own count and list of days.

start_day.description: The start time for the export specified when creating the job

end_day.description: The end time for the export specified when creating the job

job_sid.description: The job_sid returned when the export was created

email.description: The optional email to send the completion notification to

estimated_completion_time.description: this is the time estimated until your job is complete. This is calculated each time you request the job list. The time is calculated based on the current rate of job completion (which may vary) and your job queue position

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: The type of communication – Messages or Calls, Conferences, and Participants

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

StartDay.description: The start day for the custom export specified as a string in the format of yyyy-mm-dd

EndDay.description: The end day for the custom export specified as a string in the format of yyyy-mm-dd. End day is inclusive and must be 2 days earlier than the current UTC day.

FriendlyName.description: The friendly name specified when creating the job

WebhookUrl.description: The optional webhook url called on completion of the job. If this is supplied, `WebhookMethod` must also be supplied. If you set neither webhook nor email, you will have to check your job's status manually.

WebhookMethod.description: This is the method used to call the webhook on completion of the job. If this is supplied, `WebhookUrl` must also be supplied.

Email.description: The optional email to send the completion notification to. You can set both webhook, and email, or one or the other. If you set neither, the job will run but you will have to query to determine your job's status.

parameters.name: JobSid
parameters.description: The unique string that that we created to identify the Bulk Export job
